channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: 'He gave us a voice': Supporters reflect on the life of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Tens of thousands of mourners came to State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona, Sunday to remember the life of Charlie Kirk. NPR spoke with some of them.

item.title: Thousands gather to mourn conservative activist Charlie Kirk
item.description: Thousands of mourners, including President Trump and notable members of his administration, gathered Sunday at a memorial service for conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: From forgiveness to vengeance, the messages shared at Charlie Kirk's memorial service
item.description: President Trump and other conservative figures spoke Sunday at Charlie Kirk's memorial service. NPR speaks with Will Sommer, a senior reporter for The Bulwark, about the messages they shared.

item.title: As more countries recognize a Palestinian state, residents call for action, not words
item.description: Over the weekend, Canada, Australia and the United Kingdom recognized Palestine as a sovereign state. But Palestinians, worn from war, say they want to see more action, not just words.

item.title: This small Virginia island could be underwater before the next century
item.description: Tangier Island in Virginia — one of the last inhabited islands in the Chesapeake Bay — is under threat from rising sea levels and climate change.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Mourners gathered Sunday to remember Charlie Kirk, Trump wants the Justice Department to investigate his political rivals, Palestinians react as more countries recognize them as a sovereign state

item.title: New documentary 'In Whose Name?' captures tumultuous period in Kanye West's life
item.description: When he was just a teenager, Nico Ballesteros was given enough access to Ye, formerly Kanye West, that he filmed for hours. The result is a documentary called "In Whose Name?"

item.title: Lawsuit alleging Amazon made Prime too hard to cancel goes to trial
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit accusing Amazon of tricking people into paying for Prime memberships that were purposefully difficult to cancel. The trial starts Monday.

item.title: Trump's $100K fee for H-1B visas creates chaos, confusion for employers and workers
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Friday that adds a $100,000 fee for high-skilled workers to enter the country through the H-1B visa program, creating panic for employers and workers.

item.title: Once considered the off-season, fall travel is on the rise
item.description: Once the off-season, fall travel is now booming. But the season has its own unique set of rewards and challenges.
